thread.title: Chinese FA Cup: Ba scores twice to lead Blue Devils to tournament Final
thread.title_full: Chinese FA Cup: Ba scores twice to lead Blue Devils to tournament Final

title: Chinese FA Cup: Ba scores twice to lead Blue Devils to tournament Final
text:
Chinese FA Cup: Ba scores twice to lead Blue Devils to tournament Final 
  
Shanghai Shenhua made the trip to Beijing Beikong for the second leg of their Chinese FA Cup Semi-Final. In the first match back in Shanghai, the Blue Devils edged the League One side 3-2, giving them a slight advantage heading into last night's encounter at the Olympic Center.But Beijing need only one goal to advance.Yan Xiangchuang almost puts them in front inside the first minute, but sends his low shot straight at the keeper.It's Shenhua who grab the lead in the 17th minute. Tim Cahill's one-timer just slipping inside the post.The visitors double the tally 10 minutes later. Cahill turns provider as he finds Demba Ba from close range. The former Chelsea striker taps it in to make it 2-0.11 minutes from time Ba is at it again, bursting into the box and easily sliding it into the far side to make it 3-0 for Shanghai.Beikong finally get on the board in stoppage time with a penalty, but Shenhua score again as it finishes 4-1, for a 7-3 total on aggregate as Shanghai reach the final of the FA Cup. Shanghai Shenhua 4 - Beijing Beikong 1 
Blue & White reach final with 4-1 aggregate victory The other semi-final sees Jiangsu Sainty in blue taking on Shandong Luneng. Jiangsu won the first leg 2-1 away, and Wu Xi blows a marvelous chance to give them the opening goal at home as he sends it wide.Sainty do go ahead around the hour mark when Sun Ke volleys into the corner. Well timed finish there, 1-0 for Jiangsu.Sammir then scores with a low drive in stoppage time to seal the 2-0 victory. Sainty reach the final after beating the Orange Fighters 4-1 on aggregate.The first leg of the Chinese FA Cup final is on November 22nd, when Jiangsu will host Shenhua who made the final for the first time in 17 years. The second leg will be played a week later at Shanghai and the winners of the title will qualify for the AFC Champions League next season. Related Videos
